data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Doing the steps correctly, you go forward; Doing the steps incorrectly means you go back. The starting point is the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

You must return to the starting point after Turning around to turn right. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 6 steps to the starting point and take 4 steps to get to the beginning point. Take 10 steps and get to the starting point again and take 4 steps to get to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn left. Take 5 steps. Yes. If you follow instructions correctly you should return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

Turn left twice for the first 9 steps, then turn left twice. The second 9 steps are for the first 3 steps, then turn left twice for the next 3 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn around and back in the beginning direction. So it is a no.

If you take 6 steps back from the starting point, the total number of steps to get there is 6 + 6 = 12 steps. If you turn around, you see that you can return to the starting point with 8 steps taken. Thus, the answer is yes.

When you follow the instructions, you always face forward and take one step left, take one step forward, take four steps forward, take six steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

It is the same thing as taking 3 steps forward. It does return to the starting point in each case. So, the answer is no.

This is an example of a backwards direction. If you are facing forward, you will always face forward. Reversing the direction is the same as reverse. So, the answer is yes.

Turn around means get turned around the corner, and turn left again. The same would be done with, 4 steps are repeated. 8 steps are repeated, then again back to the starting point. Thus, the answer is No.

Taking 2 steps in the directions of turning around and taking 2 steps out means you are turning around and taking 2 steps which means you have been turning round and taking 2 steps for ect. If you are facing forward at first, you are likely facing forward. Remember, facing forward is the dominant movement. If you are facing backwards, you are likely traveling backward.
